transcript: there are two types of questions in the English language attacking questions and buying questions you don't defend against attacking questions by answering them you attack the attacking questions by responding to them with a question that attacks the frame of the originator so whoever asks the question who's always in control of the conversation buying questions you answer because those are things around Logistics like what happens next how do I sign this contract but if someone says tell me more about your experience that is an attacking question because they want to deframe you and so then you have to ask and attack the frame of their question so you say What specifically you're looking for as long as you keep the other person answering you are in control
